results.title: Sunday in the park with George
results.creator_credit: Terry Hughes, Iris Merlis, American Playhouse Theatrical Films, Brandman Productions, Emanuel Azenberg, Michael Brandman and Schubert Organization
results.brief_description: A musical interpretation of George Seurat’s painting “A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte” based loosely on Seurat’s life and book by James Lapine. Music and lyrics by Stephen Sondheim, musical director and conductor, Paul Gemignani - originally directed for the Broadway stage by James Lapine. Cast also includes Charles Kimbrough, Barbara Bryne, Dana Ivey, Mary D’arcy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Hughes, Iris Merlis, American Playhouse Theatrical Films, Brandman Productions, Emanuel Azenberg, Michael Brandman and Schubert Organization

results.title: Sunbury
results.creator_credit: John Dixon and Cambridge Film Production
results.brief_description: The Sunbury Music Festival, held each Australia Day between 1972 and 1975 holds fond memories for the 35,000 plus people who attended. This video shows highlights of the first festival in 1972 and captures the excitement of a festival which showcased Australian Rock music and provides a document of Australian society in the seventies.

results.title: Super sense. Part 1
results.brief_description: Imagine being able to experience the world through animal senses, to go on a unique journey into the heart of the animal kingdom. Using recently pioneered breakthroughs in filming and special effects photography, the journey is now made possible. Three episodes on this one cassette. “Sixth sense”: Animals showing special powers have often been regarded as ‘supernatural’ but this film reveals that creatures which possess a sixth sense are very much a part of the natural world. “Seeing sense”: Vision may be man’s best sense, but four-eyed fish which see above and below water simultaneously teach us that our sight is not the most sophisticated. “Sound sense”: Until now, we have been unable to hear the high-pitched squeaks of mice or the low-frequency calls whales use to communicate across hundreds of miles of sea. This episode opens our ears to a whole register of sounds. A natural landmark in natural history filming, this video is an extraordinary viewing experience.

results.title: Sun, surf and sand
results.creator_credit: Annice Vass, Gillian Reeves and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: This compilation of Newsreels celebrates 40 years of Australian beach culture from 1931-1975. Highlights include: Neck-to-knee and bikini fashions; women’s and men’s surf-lifesaving carnivals; bathing beauty competitions; Beach activities; Sydney to Hobart yacht race (1958); Iron man races, water skiing, skin diving and surf boat marathons. The footage is taken from original newsreel prints, so the quality may vary depending upon the quality of the original.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Annice Vass, Gillian Reeves and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia

results.title: Super Cars
results.brief_description: Iain Finlay introduces sixty action-packed minutes that place you behind the wheel of the world’s most powerful and stylish speed machines.

results.title: Super Boats
results.brief_description: Come sailing on a worldwide, whirlwing adventure as Beyond 2000 examines the future of life on the ocean waves. A dinghy that flies, the world’s first water-jet propelled private luxury ocean cruiser, and windweapon - a cross between a windsurfer and a hang glider are just three of the amazing discoveries.

results.title: Sacred Heart College for boys (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place Where Books Are Kept”.
Examines new techniques and attitudes towards the total library services in a Catholic boarding school for boys. Emphasises centralised resources, individualised study and production of new teaching aids. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Sunshine North Technical School
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place Where Books Are Kept”
Examines new techniques and attitudes toward the total library services in a co-educational technical school in Victoria (Sunshine North Technical School) with a large migrant student population.

results.title: Woodbridge District School (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place Where Books Are Kept”.
This film shows a media-mobile van visiting a school. The crew on the van is shown instructing the staff of the school in a range of audio-visual activities. Some examples of software are shown and various suggestions are given as to their use within the curricula. Suitable for tertiary level and teachers.
